org.cougaar.mts.base
Interface DestinationQueue

All Known Implementing Classes:
DestinationQueueDelegateImplBase, TraceAspect.DestinationQueueDelegate
public interface DestinationQueue

The fourth station for an outgoing message is a DestinationQueue. In this implementation, the DestinationQueueFactory instantiates one DestinationQueue per destination address and is accessible to certain impl classes as the MTS-internal service DestinationQueueProviderService.

The dispatching thread associated with this queue will send dequeued messages on to the 'best' DestinationLink, handling retries if an exception occurs.

The holdMessage method is used to queue messages in preparation for passing them onto the next stop, a transport-specific DestinationLink. Ordinarily this would only be called from a Router.

The matches method is used by the DestinationQueueFactory to avoid making more than one queue for a given destinationAddress.

The previous station is Router. The next station is DestinationLink.

See Also:
DestinationQueueFactory, SendLink, SendQueue, Router, DestinationLink, MessageWriter, MessageReader, MessageDeliverer, Javadoc contributions by George Mount.

Method Detail

holdMessage

void holdMessage(AttributedMessage message)
Adds the message to the queue. Since the queue runs its own thread, this call is typically the last element in the Router thread's call sequence.

dispatchNextMessage

void dispatchNextMessage(AttributedMessage message)
Handles the next message popped off the queue. Finds the most appropriate DestinationLink based on the LinkSelectionPolicy and calls its addMessageAttributes before forwardMessage to dispatch.

See Also:
LinkSelectionPolicy, Router.routeMessage(AttributedMessage), DestinationLink.addMessageAttributes(MessageAttributes), DestinationLink.forwardMessage(AttributedMessage)

matches

boolean matches(MessageAddress address)
Returns true iff this queue was created for the given destination. Used by the DestinationQueueFactory.

size

int size()
Number of messages waiting in the queue.

getDestination

MessageAddress getDestination()
Returns the address for which this DestinationQueue was created.

snapshot

AttributedMessage[] snapshot()
Return a snapshot of the current contents of the queue.
